headline: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Carnival vs. Disney
summary: Carnival continues to break multiple operating and financial records amid strong demand for its cruise vacations.  The Walt Disney Company is benefiting from a resilient consumer spending environment, fueling its media and entertainment empire.  Leisure and entertainment giants Carnival (NYSE: CCL) and The Walt Disney Company (NYSE: DIS) offer an abundance of options for anyone thinking about taking a vacation this summer.

headline: Disney to Pay Comcast $438.7M for Full Hulu Ownership, Ending Valuation Dispute
summary: The Walt Disney Company (NYSE:DIS) is one of the best Dow stocks to invest in. The company has agreed to pay Comcast $438.7 million to buy out its remaining stake in the streaming service Hulu, ending a lengthy appraisal process. In 2023, The Walt Disney Company (NYSE:DIS) announced its plan to acquire Comcast’s 33% share […]

headline: Hollywood enters AI scraping wars with new lawsuit from Disney and NBCUniversal
summary: Disney and NBCUniversal sued an artificial intelligence developer for allegedly infringing on their protected works, the first Hollywood corporate titans to join a mushrooming legal war pitting copyright holders against AI upstarts.

headline: Disney, Universal Sue Midjourney Over AI-Generated Princesses and Minions
summary: Disney and Universal sued Midjourney, alleging that the artificial-intelligence company’s image-generating service produces unauthorized copies of the studios’ copyrighted works.

raw.headline: Disney, Universal Sue Midjourney Over AI-Generated Princesses and Minions
raw.summary: Disney and Universal sued Midjourney, alleging that the artificial-intelligence company’s image-generating service produces unauthorized copies of the studios’ copyrighted works.

headline: Disney, Universal sue image creator Midjourney for copyright infringement
summary: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) -Walt Disney and Comcast's Universal filed a copyright lawsuit against Midjourney on Wednesday, calling its popular AI-powered image generator a "bottomless pit of plagiarism" for its use of the studios' best-known characters.  The suit, filed in federal district court in Los Angeles, claims Midjourney pirated the libraries of the two Hollywood studios, making and distributing without permission "innumerable" copies of characters such as Darth Vader from "Star Wars," Elsa from "Frozen," and the Minions from "Despicable Me".

raw.headline: Disney, Universal sue image creator Midjourney for copyright infringement

headline: DIS Q1 Earnings Call: Streaming Integration, Theme Park Expansion, and Strategic Partnerships Highlight Growth Plans
summary: Global entertainment and media company Disney (NYSE:DIS) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 7% year on year to $23.62 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.45 per share was 19.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
